func.newdoc:
These tests could be collapsed into one big boolean expression, but they have been left as independent tests for clarity. * GWT claims to support java.lang.Character's char-classification methods, * but it actually only works for ASCII. So for now, assume any non-ASCII * characters are valid. The only place this seems to be documented is here: * http://osdir.com/ml/GoogleWebToolkitContributors/2010-03/msg00178.html * *

ASCII characters in the part are expected to be valid per RFC 1035, * with underscore also being allowed due to widespread practice. No initial dash or underscore. No final underscore. * Note that we allow (in contravention of a strict interpretation of the * relevant RFCs) domain parts other than the last may begin with a digit * (for example, "3com.com"). It's important to disallow an initial digit in * the last part; it's the only thing that stops an IPv4 numeric address * like 127.0.0.1 from looking like a valid domain name.
func.olddoc:
These tests could be collapsed into one big boolean expression, but they have been left as independent tests for clarity. * GWT claims to support java.lang.Character's char-classification methods, * but it actually only works for ASCII. So for now, assume any non-ASCII * characters are valid. The only place this seems to be documented is here: * http://osdir.com/ml/GoogleWebToolkitContributors/2010-03/msg00178.html * *

ASCII characters in the part are expected to be valid per RFC 1035, * with underscore also being allowed due to widespread practice. No initial or final dashes or underscores. * Note that we allow (in contravention of a strict interpretation of the * relevant RFCs) domain parts other than the last may begin with a digit * (for example, "3com.com"). It's important to disallow an initial digit in * the last part; it's the only thing that stops an IPv4 numeric address * like 127.0.0.1 from looking like a valid domain name.
func.methodSig: private static boolean validatePart(String part, boolean isFinalPart)

addcode:
* <li>Underscores ('_') are permitted within parts (not the first or
   *     last character).
   * <li>Dashes ('-') are permitted as the last character of parts (in
   *     addition to being permitted within parts, per the standard).
delcode: * <li>Underscores ('_') are permitted wherever dashes ('-') are permitted.
